page.description: Create abbreviations for inserting code snippets using Alpha Anywhere's auto-complete system.
page.discussion: You can create abbreviations that, when typed, automatically insert code snippets in the JavaScript and Xbasic editors. This can significantly improve your productivity when you are writing Xbasic and JavaScript code.

description.p: For example, say that in the JavaScript editor you frequently type the following code:

You can now define an abbreviation for this code snippet. Every time you type the abbreviation, it is automatically expanded. For example, you might specify that the abbreviation for the above code snippet is *[js:.gc]*.
Every time you type *[js:.gc]* in the code editor, *[js:.gc]* will be replaced with *[js:var lObj = {dialog.object}.getControl(]*

The replacement text for the abbreviation can be arbitrarily long. It does not have to be a single line of text as in the above example. You can also specify where the insertion point should be placed after the abbreviation has been expanded.
You can also set rules that control when an abbreviation is expanded. For example, you can specify:

item.name: Only expand abbreviations that appear at the start of the line

Only expand abbreviations that are preceded by a word boundary. For example, if you have defined an abbreviation *[js:do]* (that expands to *[js:{dialog.object}]*) if would be expanded if you typed *[js:do]* after a space character. But would not be expanded if you typed *[js:abcdo]* because the do abbreviation is not preceded by a word boundary.

description.p: You can also specify if the abbreviations should be shown in auto-complete (just like auto-complete for functions and variables), as shown in the image below. If you specify that an abbreviation should be shown in auto-complete, you can define an optional description that will also be shown in auto-complete.
To define a glossary while editing either Xbasic or JavaScript, right click, and select the *[ui:Edit glossary]* command from the menu. The glossary editor is shown below:
Each line in the image aboves shows the abbreviation, expansion for the abbreviation, and expansion options. Expansion options include:

item.name: F
item.description: Expand if first word is on a line

item.name: W
item.description: Expand if preceded by a word boundary

description.p: To edit an individual glossary entry, double click on the item, or click the Edit button. The editor is displayed where you can define both the abbreviation and the replacement text. You can also set the options for the glossary item.
